subject: Learning
title: Why Metacognition Matters More Than IQ
description: A micro-lesson that makes Why Metacognition Matters More Than IQ usable.

hook.text: A student with average IQ and great metacognition consistently outperforms a gifted student who lacks it.

buildup.text: Research across thousands of students shows metacognition is a stronger predictor of grades than IQ.

discovery.text: IQ helps you process. Metacognition helps you decide what to process, when, and how.

twist.text: High-IQ students without metacognition often coastâ€”until challenges overwhelm their raw ability.

climax.text: The good news: unlike IQ, metacognition is highly teachable. Any student can develop it.

punchline.text: IQ is given. Metacognition is grown. Grow it.

quiz.question: Why does metacognition predict academic success better than IQ?
options: It controls how, when, and what to learn, not just processing speed
IQ has no effect on learning at all
Metacognition replaces the need for intelligence
